resources.string: Tipatch was unable to find your device\'s recovery partition. Select an image file and flash it instead.
\n\nIf you want your device to be supported in the future, send a device report with the button below. No personal information is contained.

What is Tipatch?

Tipatch patches TWRP recovery to back up your internal storage (emulated SD card), meaning your photos, music, game data, downloads, and more will be saved in backups.

How do I use Tipatch?

If your device is rooted, you can patch your currently-installed recovery (both slots if your device is A/B) in-place, without having to download or flash any images.

If you\'re not rooted, don\'t worry! You can still use Tipatch. Simply download your device\'s recovery image, open it in Tipatch, and save the resulting patched image. Then, flash or boot this final image like any other one.

Effects

To confirm whether it worked, boot into TWRP. Signs of success are:
    • "Data (excl. storage)" becoming "Data (incl. storage)"
    • "Backups of Data do not include…" when backing up becoming "Backups of Data include…"
    • Bigger calculated size of Data in Backup screen, because more is included

Problems?

If Tipatch does not work properly on your device (any of the above signs aren\'t present, or it doesn\'t actually back up the data), please let me know! You can find a Contact button in the menu.

Enjoy!
